intro: Piper cyrtopodum, commonly known as the small-leaf pepper or Cyrtopodum pepper, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species such as black pepper. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a small, elongated berry that turns from green to yellow as it matures. Piper cyrtopodum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has limited use in traditional medicine.
